intro: Saurauia planchonii, commonly known as the planchonii stonecrop, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Crassulaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming leaves that are typically fleshy and covered in a waxy coating. It produces small, star-shaped flowers that are usually white or pale pink, blooming in the spring. Saurauia planchonii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
